references.paper_title: Discovering governing equations from data by sparse identification of nonlinear dynamical systems
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sparse Identification of Nonlinear Dynamics (SINDy) algorithm, a core method used and extended in the current research.

references.paper_title: Discovering symbolic models from deep learning with inductive biases
references.reason: This work explores using genetic programming, another key method leveraged and improved upon in the current work, to discover symbolic models from data.

references.paper_title: Data-driven discovery of coordinates and governing equations
references.reason: This paper presents a method combining sparse regression with autoencoders, a technique the current research builds upon and extends for symmetry-informed equation discovery.

references.paper_title: Weak SINDy: Galerkin-based data-driven model selection
references.reason: This work introduces Weak SINDy, addressing limitations of the original SINDy algorithm by using a variational form, a concept relevant to the improvements in the current research.
This paper details LaLiGAN, a crucial component of the current research's pipeline for learning and utilizing symmetries in equation discovery.
